project.title: Warmth
project.description:
I had the pleasure of working with MrSuicideSheep on this project! These animated illustrations are a ton of fun to work on! The illustration was created in photoshop on top of a 3D base from Blender - hand animated the fire, steam and smoke in Procreate - snow and trees animated in After Effects, along with the overall compositing.

For more: https://www.instagram.com/gavinodonnellart/

project.title: Father / Son collaboration
project.description: My son challenged me to bring one of his drawings to life in 3D. I was hesitant because modeling characters is not what I do and getting CBB( Could Be Better ) notes from him would not be fun ü§£ü§£ü§£. But I figured it could be something cool to do /learn from and went along with it. I took some liberties but hopefully he thinks it‚Äôs ok üòÇ. Glad to start the new year off with something different for me. Happy New Year everyone!

project.title: The Christmas Tree Summoning!
project.description:
Hello ArtStation! [first post ALERT]

The Christmas Tree Summoning!

Here is my entry for #JingleBellJam ! I‚Äôve always wanted to create work for children‚Äôs stories so I tried to channel that charm within this piece. I was inspired by Dr. Seuss‚Äôs story The Lorax and I‚Äôd like to think there‚Äôs a little bit of him within my tree character!
The song lyrics ‚ÄòO Christmas Tree, O Christmas Tree how lovely are thy branches‚Äô came to me as some sort of magical charm or conjuring to summon something!

Glad I could take part in an awesome idea prompt and for it to be my first post.

Merry Christmas to all!

RobbieGoldieArt

project.title: Too Late | Animated Short Film
project.description:
"Too Late" is an animated psychological thriller, a stylized look at the destructive nature of overwork.
Winner of several awards, including the Director's prize at Spark Animation, "Too Late" has been accepted into over 30 festivals around the world, and still continues its festival circuit into 2021.

With a small team of feature animation artists, we lovingly crafted this somewhat dark animated thriller, in hopes to shine some light on the overtime cycle we often find ourselves trapped in.

Roy Stein - Writer/ Director

project.title: TAQQUT PRODUCTIONS ‚ÄúGIANT BEAR‚Äù
project.description:
A timeless Inuit story about a solitary man, a giant bear and their daunting foes: each other.
Centered on a confrontation between the last monster bear and an Inuit hunter, Giant Bear is a chilling short that brings an ancient story out of the North.
In Giant Bear, we follow a hunter in the depths of starvation. The snow is thick, his dogs are mysteriously dying and food is nowhere to be found. A quest for answers leads him straight to a nanurluk, an iceberg-sized polar bear, setting up a ‚Äúkill or be killed‚Äù battle that pits one man‚Äôs wits against a fearsome foe.

Animated in a painterly, hybrid 2D and 3D style, some of the film was made using real time animation from Unity game engine, via the open source Scene Track plug-in. This traditional Inuit legend explores the power, beauty, and perils of nature through a meticulously handcrafted CG animation lens.

The score, by composer Tyler Fitzmaurice in collaboration with singer Beatrice Deer, bassist Michael Felber, synth player Parker Shper, and electronic musician Greg Debicki (Woulg), features traditional northern singing techniques woven into an ethereal soundscape to bring the tundra to life.

Teaser Music: Beatrice Deer Band
https://beatricedeer.bandcamp.com/album/my-all-to-you

A co-production between Taqqut Productions (Iqaluit) and e‚Üíd films (Montreal).

Supported by Nunavut Film Development Corporation
QIA - Qikiqtani Inuit Association

Produced with the assistance of the National Film Board of Canada - Filmmaker Assistance Program

project.description:
Some concepts of Panam Palmer, cyberpunk queen of the desert. It's so fun to work on such a charismatic NPC!  

Her hair was an especially tricky subject, we had dozens of iterations of it. Finally, she got a characteristic bun, designed by our art director and character team lead - Pawe≈Ç Mielniczuk. And it looks great, I can't imagine her now without it. ;)

project.title: Rural Cabins
project.description:
Until this point I never made a modular wall set. I wanted to learn how to do this because I think it is an essential skill to have as an environment artist. When I was making the set I realized wanted to create a full environment around it.
My goal was to capture a small town in the American mid-west.
This is how it turned out!
If you want to play around with it yourself you can get it here: https://www.unrealengine.com/marketplace/en-US/product/2ddbe37c08db4ca3abf0b178aae465bf

project.title: LOVE AND MONSTERS - LEAD MODELER - CREATING THE HELLCRAB
project.description:
Hi guys,
Here are a few screencap of Love and Monsters, a project on which I was Lead modeler working for MillFilm.
The HellCrab was the biggest monster of the movie, It was cut in lots of different Ztools. It's anatomy allowed us to create so many pieces than combined all together it reach 0.8 BILLION polygons in Zbrush.
Habib Kassassir helped me a lot on that one, displacement was done in Mari then projected in Zbrush. Each eyes and iris were sculpted in Zbrush and reach 80 millions each.
Asset supervisor was Samuel Jensen / Lead Texture Brittany Bell / Lead Modeling myself, Avishek Podder was our Lead Modeling in Bangalore.
I hope you' enjoy it ;)

project.title: Khedemar- Prophet's Respite
project.description: The stepwells of Prophets Respite; an ethereal plane that the Prophets of Khedemar head to when gathering power and formulating thoughts. This is a meditation chamber of sorts where the thoughts of all beings are shared, where one mind merges with another, and all ideas become one. This concept is reflected in the seemingly neverending stepwells of this world, with infinite areas to descend into. The last frames show the threads of life, inactive and active, as they start to bind materials together.

project.description:

I added all approved iterations on the rifle to showcase how it was developed.
All rights are with CD Projekt Red and their respective owners.

project.title: Xiang XiaoLu, the Golem Maker
project.description:
I was lost in how to draw ‚Äúwell‚Äù these weeks. What do good looks like? details? style? story? but all these are subjective things, this means it doesn't have an answer that can tell me what is correct. However, I used to work hard and try to level my art up to meet different requirements for a very long time. The more I did, the worse I felt. Why I have to cater to those subjective bars, I‚Äôd rather draw what I love. The only thing I was thinking about while drawing this picture is to please myself, I draw what I like and what I think is correct, this is the only way to show myself through my art.

Sketches below are the concept for characters in the same world from my IP.

Thanks for viewing and reading.

project.title: Dark Waters Jinx
project.description:
Original concept belongs to the fantastic Ian su! check out his work -> https://www.artstation.com/artwork/3dq6Wo

I was responsible for the highpoly sculpt in zbrush, the lowpoly retopology, UV's and Rigging in Maya, and the hand painted textures in photoshop and Substance painter. 

My goal with this piece was to come as close as i could to the league of legends ingame style. I studied alot of Kyle gage, Yekaterina Bourykina, and Duy Khanh Nguyen work. 

this piece will be updated over time , enjoy!

project.title: A Sanguine Scheme
project.description:
This scene is an original piece with inspiration from the Vampire the Masquerade IP. This was made for a module on my Game art master. I am thrilled with the way the scene has come out, and it has helped me alot to learn more about the lighting systems within UE4.
-------------------------------------------------------------
I would like to say a massive thank you to the people at Dinusty and Experience Points for all the help and feedback on this project! Without everyone, the scene would not have come out the way it has and for that I'm thankful! There are many people I would like to mention but I would like to say a massive thank you to both Alex Beddows & Martin de Graaf. They both kept pushing me throughout this project with feedback and tips and it has been amazing! So again thank you.

https://www.artstation.com/alexbeddows

https://www.artstation.com/martindegraaf

project.title: Mobile Suit Gundam: The 08th MS Team
Prop Texturing in Substance Designer
project.description:
Get the tutorial here: https://gum.co/levelup_phonebox
Learn how to make a highly detailed prop procedurally from industry professional Lee Borrer. In this tutorial, Lee will demonstrate how to use Substance Designer along with simple geometry to create a realistic smashed up phone box.  
Step by step, he walks you through the creation of the components and shares valuable tips along the way. He shares his personal tips and  tricks for how to create aging effects, graffiti and damage. You'll learn how to expose parameters to create variations such as the level of glass shattering and mildew growth. 
This tutorial is packed with lessons for anyone looking to learn about texturing and the advantages of using SD for prop creation.

project.title: Zyra Queen of Thorns
project.description: This is a fan illustration of Zyra. A champion from League of Legends that I've been working on in my free time. Originally started as a practice sketch thought it might be fun and educational to complete. Learned a lot in the process and looking to apply those lessons in the next few illustrations.
